name: Drum Brain
description:
Dust off your favorite rhythm game peripheral, and plug it into your PC! Now you can record songs, or play along to your favorite music with DrumBrain!

FEATURES

  • Supports USB Rockband and Guitar Hero instruments
    • Must be recognized by Windows as a Game Controller
    • XBOX 360 and PS3 only (Wii and PS4 not supported)
  • Velocity sensitivity (when supported by hardware)
  • Training modules
  • Multiple drum kits
  • Record songs with the tracker interface
  • Export your recordings to WAV
  • Practice drums without spending a fortune on eDrums

*** BEFORE YOU PURCHASE! ***

  • Windows 10 does not support reading velocity sensitivity
    • Microsoft has removed support for this. I am currently investigating workarounds, but the reality is there simply may not be one.
  • Hardware troubleshooting/support will not be provided
    • Please ensure your hardware is already recognized by windows as a Game Controller before purchasing (click here for details). For PS3, you may need to install additional 3rd party software* (at your own risk).
  • Wii and Rockband 4 drum devices are currently not supported
    • Due to hardware limitations, these drumkits are not supported.

DrumBrain currently supports the following drum sets:

  • Rockband 1 wired drumset (XBOX, PS3)
  • Rockband 2 wireless drumset (XBOX, PS3)
  • Rockband 3 wireless drumset (XBOX, PS3)
  • Rockband cymbals
  • Guitar Hero World Tour drumset (XBOX, PS3)
  • ION DrumRocker
  • Mad Catz portable Rockband drums

System Requirements:

  • Windows Vista, or better (Windows 7 or later recommended)
  • OpenGL 2.0 capable video card with latest drivers
  • Dual core CPU recommended
  • One of the supported devices listed below

VERSION 0.72 UPDATE

  • Proper Windows 10 support (still no velocity sensitivity, however)
  • Crash, and bug fixes

*DISCLAIMER:

No warranties are provided. Andrew Rudson takes no responsibility for damage caused due to misuse, user error, installing third party software, third party hardware, or any other unforeseen consequence of using DrumBrain.
